page.title: 15The Trout Farm
page.content:
in the school. There is a local amateur dramatic society called the Yew Group which produces plays in the Church.
There is a{Trout Farm}in the S.W. corner of our block. The building where the young trout are reared was previously a mill where local farmers took their corn to be ground into flour until early in the 1920's. When the trout are larger they are put into one of the large ponds which make up 10 acres of the farm. When they are 1 or 2 years old they are sent all over the British Isles to re-stock rivers and lakes for angling. This particular farm introduced trout into the Falklands in 1953, and exports trout eggs to S. Africa, Kenya, India and Sri Lanka. Part of the area around the trout
